sub_title: Senior Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning (MEL) Advisor at Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs
summary: Experienced researcher and advisor, specialised in the design and implementation of complex monitoring, evaluation and learning (MEL) systems. Over 15 years of experience, more than half of which in East Africa and the MENA region. Has worked extensively with academics, policymakers and practitioners, on entrepreneurship, private sector development (PSD) and socio-economic recovery in fragile states. Experience leading national and international teams. Authored various peer-reviewed academic publications.

Other activities aimed at stimulating exchange between academia, practitioners, policymakers and business on the theme of post-conflict enterprise development include:

* The making of a short documentary film about some of the research findings in Juba, South Sudan (see media below)

* Organizing the co-creation and 'appreciative inquiry' dialogue: "Doing Business in South Sudan" in June 2013 at the Dutch ministry of foreign affairs. (attended by Dutch and South Sudanese entrepreneurs, policymakers, NGO practitioners and academics)

* Co-organizing the Netherlands African Business Council (NABC) trade mission to South Sudan in October 2011

* Organizing an international seminar on "Growth and Equity in Fragile States" organized in October 2010 at the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs (keynote speaker: Graciana Del Castillo)
